API Interface of OrbitDB¶

The OrbitDB interface.

OrbitDB class¶

class OrbitDB(ipfs, identity, options)¶

OrbitDB instance

OrbitDB.databaseTypes¶

Returns supported database types as an Array of strings Eg. [ ‘counter’, ‘eventlog’, ‘feed’, ‘docstore’, ‘keyvalue’]

OrbitDB._haveLocalData(cache, dbAddress)¶

Check if we have the database, or part of it, saved locally

Arguments

  • cache (Array.<Cache>) – [The OrbitDBCache instance containing the local data]

  • dbAddress (Array.<OrbitDBAddress>) – [Address of the database to check]

Returns

Array.<Boolean> – [Returns true if we have cached the db locally, false if not]

OrbitDB._migrate(Object, OrbitDBAddress)¶

Runs all migrations inside the src/migration folder

Arguments

  • Object – options Options to pass into the migration

  • OrbitDBAddress – dbAddress Address of database in OrbitDBAddress format

OrbitDB.disconnect()¶

Disconnect OrbitDB instance from the network.

OrbitDB.feed(address)¶

Open or create a new feed database

Arguments

  • address (OrbitDBAddress|string) – or name of the database to open/create

OrbitDB.log(address, options)¶

Open or create a new log database

OrbitDB.open(address, options)¶

Open a database by it’s address.

Arguments

  • address (OrbitDBAddress|string) – to connect to.

  • options.localOnly (boolean) – if set to true, throws an error if database can’t be found locally

  • options.create (boolean) – whether to create the database.

  • options.type – TODO

  • options.overwrite – TODO

OrbitDB.createInstance(ipfs, options)¶

Return an instance of OrbitDB given an IPFS or HTTP-IPFS-Client

Arguments

  • ipfs – the js-ipfs instance or ipfshttpclient instance

  • options – several options

Returns

instance of orbitdb

OrbitDBAddress class¶

class OrbitDBAddress(root, path)¶

OrbitDB Addresses validation, parsing and generation

OrbitDBAddress.isValid(address)¶

Validate, that an address follows this format: /orbitdb/<multihash>/<name>

Arguments

  • address (OrbitDBAddress|string) – to validate.

Returns

boolean – whether the address has a valid format.

OrbitDBAddress.join(paths)¶

Join with prefix /orbitdb

OrbitDBAddress.parse(address)¶

Parse an address

Arguments

  • address (OrbitDBAddress|string) – to parse.

Returns

OrbitDBAddress – parsed address
